modules.description: Returns the current POSIX time in days and picoseconds, retrieves the local time zone offset in seconds, and provides the clock's picosecond period when available. Operates with integer and 64-bit integer tuples to represent time values. Used for precise time synchronization and timezone-aware timestamp calculations.

Handles SMTP protocol operations such as connecting, sending EHLO, MAIL, RCPT, DATA, and QUIT commands. Works with socket connections, email headers, and message bodies to construct and transmit email data. Used to build custom SMTP clients or servers with support for TLS and asynchronous I/O through Lwt.

Provides precise time management through integer-based time representations, including POSIX time in days and picoseconds, local time zone offsets, and clock resolution. Supports operations for time synchronization and timezone-aware calculations using 64-bit integer tuples. Can convert between absolute and local time, adjust timestamps for time zones, and measure high-resolution clock periods. Enables accurate time handling in network and system applications.
